data.title: Putnam Scanner for December 17, 2019
data.meta_description: County Jail Seven people were booked in the Putnam County Jail recently. Monday * At 5:32 a.m. Michelle D. Wilson, 49, Poland, was housed at the jail for driving while intoxicated. Saturday * At 11:11 p.m. Jonathan M. Hankins, 41, Greencastle, was booked in for intimidation, disorderly conduct, possession of marijuana and possession of paraphernalia...
data.text:
County Jail

Seven people were booked in the Putnam County Jail recently.

Monday

 At 5:32 a.m. Michelle D. Wilson, 49, Poland, was housed at the jail for driving while intoxicated.

Saturday

 At 11:11 p.m. Jonathan M. Hankins, 41, Greencastle, was booked in for intimidation, disorderly conduct, possession of marijuana and possession of paraphernalia.

Friday

 At 10:15 p.m. Jerry W. Smith, 66, Clinton, was lodged at the jail on a Vermillion County warrant.

 At 5:59 p.m. Charles T. Turpin, 25, Plainfield, was taken into custody on a warrant.

 At 11:58 a.m. Kerry W. Gilbert, 38, Greencastle, was housed at the jail on a warrant.

 At 10:43 a.m. Brandon Scott Mitchell, 20, Greencastle, was booked in for driving without ever receiving a license.

 At 10 a.m. Adam L. McCastle, 45, Greencastle, was lodged at the jail on a warrant.

Sheriffs Department

Putnam County sheriffs deputies investigated six recent property-damage crashes.

 At 6:09 p.m. on Sunday, Mary Draper, 59, Reelsville, was westbound on County Road 675 South and County Road 650 West in a 2015 Ford Escape when the vehicle slid off the road and hit a culvert.

The vehicle was damaged in the driver-side front wheel area.

The vehicle was towed. Deputy Randy Patrick estimated damage at $1,000-$2,500.

 At 5:48 p.m. Jamie J. Garry, 65, Terre Haute, was westbound in the right lane of Interstate 70 in a 2008 Lexus GX 470.

Garry told Deputy Robert Soilleux a car in the right lane attempted to change lanes and ran into the side of her car.

Thomas M. Bedway, 31, Parkman, Wyo., was westbound in a 2015 Ford F-150. He told Soilleux he started to merge when he bumped the car.

Neither driver reported injuries.

Soilleux estimated damage at $1,000-$2,500.

 At 1:16 a.m. on Sunday, Kelsey M. Whitaker, 24, Reelsville, was eastbound on County Road 50 North in a 2018 Chevrolet Traverse when she hit a deer.

Deputy Patrick estimated damage at $2,500-$5,000.

 At 3:04 p.m. on Friday, Susan White, 44, Greencastle, was westbound on State Road 240 in a 2010 Mitsubishi Lancer. Jeffrey Demichieli, 58, Indianapolis, was eastbound in a 1999 International straight truck pulling a trailer, both of which were registered to The Hoosier Company.

White told Deputy Tanner Brown that as she passed Demichielis vehicle, debris came from the truck and trailer, hitting her car.

She pulled over following the incident and complained of a sore back. She told Brown she would take herself to the ER later.

Demichieli told Brown he received a phone call from another work truck that was following him, telling him debris had been coming from his trailer. He then pulled over.

Demichieli then got into another work vehicle and returned to the scene, finding Whites vehicle on the side of the road.

Brown inspected the trailer roof, saying it looked torn and was missing pieces.

Damage was estimated at $5,000-$10,000.

 At 8:20 a.m. on Thursday, Regina D. Wilson, 56, Greencastle, was westbound on County Road 1075 South in a 2005 Freightliner L9500 Series dump truck belong to the Putnam County Highway Department. The truck was loaded with large rock.

As Wilson approached the T-intersection at County Road 525 West, she braked to stop and the brakes failed. As she went through the intersection, she turned hard right to avoid colliding head on with the guardrail.

Instead, the vehicle hit the guardrail with the left front and flipped over, coming to rest on the drivers side.

Operation Life checked out Wilson and she signed a statement of release.

The guardrail was destroyed, along with a mailbox belonging to a nearby house.

The truck was towed.

Deputy Brian Helmer estimated damage at $25,000-$50,000.

 At 7:32 p.m. on Monday, Dec. 9, Terri L. Freed, 68, Rockville, was westbound on U.S. 36 in a 2019 Chevrolet Cruze when she hit a deer.

Deputy Patrick estimated damage at $1,000-$2,500.

City Fire

The Greencastle Fire Department recently performed two medical assists and had one disregard.

Information included in the Putnam Scanner is taken from reports provided to the Banner Graphic by the Greencastle Police, the Greencastle Fire and the Putnam County Sheriffs departments.

Individuals listed in the blotter have been arrested on probable cause and have not been formally charged. Charging information may change after an initial arrest.

Questions about listed charging information should be directed to the arresting agency.
